topic.title: 2.2.3 Emergency Stop Switch Is Pressed During Machining (No Workpiece and Tool Contact)

header.para: Emergency Stop Switch Is Pressed During Machining (No Workpiece and Tool Contact)

body.para: The Automatic Recovery operation cannot be performed. Perform the following procedure to release the Emergency Stop condition and to recover the machining program.

table.style: width:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:8px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:4px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:4px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Exercise extreme care when recovering the machine from the Emergency Stop condition as serious accidents may occur.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:4px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: When working with other personnel, maintain clear communication at all times to prevent serious injury.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:4px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
li.text: Contact your Makino service representative for assistance if serious damage to the machine has occurred.

list.li: Make sure the condition(s) that led to pressing of the Emergency Stop switch are eliminated.
Rotate the Emergency Stop switch in the direction indicated by the arrow to release the lock.
Select the Reference Position Return mode.
Return each axis to its reference position so that the workpiece does not interfere with the Spindle Tool.
Check the Tool and workpiece for damage.
Restart the program on the Program Edit Screen.
Display the Program Edit Screen to confirm that the modal information is correct (Refer to NOTE 1). If the modal information is incorrect, correct the values in the MDI mode.
Move the cursor to the block in which the machine entered the Emergency Stop condition.
Input “Sxxxx” using the MDI mode and then press the [SPINDLE START] switch or input “Sxxxx M03(M04)”.
Press the Coolant Related Function switch on the main operation panel or turn ON the Coolant Related Function on the Function Screen. (Refer to NOTE 2).
Select Memory mode and then press the [CYCLE START] switch.

body.para: This completes the recovery operation performed when the Emergency Stop switch is pressed during machining.

li.text: The modal information may be reset to the original data when the machine entered the Emergency Stop condition. Serious damage to the machine or workpiece may result if a program including incorrect modal information is restarted.
Each coolant function can be started by the M-Code.
